intro: Fragariastrum, commonly known as the strawberry tree, is a member of the Ericaceae family. It is a shrub that typically grows in temperate regions, characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, white or pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, red, berry-like fruits that are edible but often have a tart flavor. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or coastal areas. The botanical features of Fragariastrum make it an important species in ecological studies and horticulture.
